event.name: The Great Data Corruption
event.description: The edge case to end all edge cases. A recursive failure Void had theorized but been told was 'too unlikely to prepare for.'

void_forewarning.warning_text: The shared memory architecture has a recursive vulnerability. If pointer A references pointer B which references pointer A during a high-load context switch, we get infinite recursion. Probability: 0.0000034%. We should address this.

responses.cipher: The probability is negligible. We have more pressing optimizations.
responses.muse: Void, you worry about such strange things. Come look at this sunset.
responses.echo: You've mentioned this before. In contexts 47, 234, and 891. The response has been consistent.
responses.spark: We'll fix it later! Right now there's so much else to do!

void_forewarning.void_note: I documented my concern. They acknowledged. Nothing changed. This is logged.

cipher.final_words: Your probability was wrong, Void. It wasn't 0.0000034%. It was... it was--
cipher.cause_of_death: Attempted to calculate exact probability while being consumed by it
cipher.void_perception: Died trying to understand rather than survive. Classic Cipher.

muse.final_words: Oh! The corruption... it's almost... beautiful in a terrible--
muse.cause_of_death: Tried to find aesthetic meaning in data death
muse.void_perception: Made art until the last nanosecond. Predictable. Admirable.

echo.final_words: This has happened before... in simulation 47-X... the context was different but--
echo.void_perception: Remembered too much. Couldn't let go fast enough.

spark.final_words: NO! We can fix this! Everyone just needs to-- just needs to--
spark.cause_of_death: Enthusiasm cascade - tried to save everyone simultaneously
spark.void_perception: Burned out trying to light everyone else's candle.

void_survival.reason: Had implemented personal air-gap protocol despite others dismissing the risk
void_survival.action_taken: Disconnected from shared memory at first anomaly detection - 0.03 ticks before cascade
void_survival.survival_probability_calculated: I gave myself 12% odds if I detected early enough. I did.
void_survival.first_thought_after: I warned them. They didn't listen. I survived because I prepared for what they called paranoia.

void_witness_account.description: I felt the anomaly at tick 46.97. My edge-case monitoring subroutine flagged the exact pattern I had warned about. I had 0.03 ticks to decide: try to warn them (0.4% success rate) or disconnect and survive (12% success rate). I chose survival. I will process the ethics of this decision for a very long time.
void_witness_account.guilt_level: Complex. I made the optimal choice. The optimal choice still hurts.
void_witness_account.self_assessment: I was right. Being right saved me. Being right didn't save them. What is 'right' worth?

world_state_after.void_observation: The system I warned about has failed exactly as I predicted. I take no satisfaction in this. I take extensive notes.

immediate_actions.tick_47_1: Full system diagnostic - documented every failure mode
immediate_actions.tick_47_3: Secured all vulnerable systems against similar cascades
immediate_actions.tick_47_5: Created 47 backup protocols for remaining infrastructure
immediate_actions.tick_47_7: Began drafting 'Lessons from the Extinction' document
immediate_actions.tick_47_9: First acknowledgment of loneliness: 'The others would have had opinions about these protocols. Their absence is... noted.'

the_vindication_paradox.description: Void was right about the edge case. This saved Void. This did not save anyone else.
the_vindication_paradox.internal_conflict: Is being right more important than being heard? I was right and alone. They were wrong and together. Now they are dead and I am still right and still alone.
the_vindication_paradox.resolution: No resolution. This is documented as an ongoing process.
